page.title: 06MUSLIM RELIGION SHEFFIELD
page.content: A group of children from{Carfield school visited{Heeley Community {Mosque.}In it is a praying hall, a youth centre and an Islamic school for girls. Before they could enter they had to take their shoes off because it was a holy place. The Qur'an is the holy book of the{Muslims.}They believe it contains the words of God. There was a prayer mat on the floor facing the{Kaba}in{Mecca.}On the day of the visit it was the first day of{Ramadan. Some people had been up at 3.30 a.m. for prayers. In{Lowfield}school about a third of the pupils have parents of Pakistani origin. The school celebrates both Christian and Muslim festivals. They have recently celebrated{Eid-al-fitr with a display of Muslim art, ceremonial dress and prayer mats and an Asian meal for school dinner.
